content.text: In the expansion of \(\left(2 + p x\right)^{5}\) the coefficient of \(x^{3}\) is equal to \(- \frac{8}{25}\) . Find the value of the constant \(p\)
Find the term independent of \(x\) in the expansion of \(\left(2x^{2} + \frac{1}{4x^{2}}\right)^{8}\)
Show that the area, \(A \mathrm{cm}^2\), of the sector is given by \(A = 10r - r^2\)
It is given that \(r\) can vary and that \(A\) has a maximum value
Find the value of \(\theta\) for which \(A\) has a maximum value
The diagram shows a sector \(POQ\) of a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(r\mathrm{cm}\), where angle \(POQ = \theta\) radians. The perimeter of the sector is \(20\mathrm{cm}\)
Find, in its simplest surf form, the length of \(AC\)
Find \(\tan BCA\), giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{3}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
Do not use a calculator in this question
In this question, all lengths are in centimetres
A triangle \(ABC\) is such that angle \(B = 90^{\circ}\), \(AB = 5\sqrt{3} + 5\) and \(BC = 5\sqrt{3} - 5\)
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\)
Given also that \(y\) is increasing at a rate of \(6 \mathrm{cm s}^{- 1}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\),
find the corresponding rate of change of \(x\)
In this question, the units of \(x\) are radians and the units of \(y\) are centimetres
It is given that \(y = (1 + \cos 3x)^{10}\)
Show that \(\log_9 4 = \log_3 2\)
Hence solve \(\log_9 4 + \log_3 x = 3\)
Find the value of \(t\) when \(P\) is instantaneously at rest
Find an expression for the acceleration of \(P\) at time \(t\) s
Find the value of \(s\) when the acceleration of \(P\) is \(0.3 \mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)
Explain why the acceleration of the particle will always be positive
A particle \(P\) is moving in a straight line such that its displacement, \(s\) m, from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) s, is given by \(s = 12\mathrm{e}^{- 0.5t} + 4t - 12.\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{AD}\) in terms of \(m\), \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{AD}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\)
Given that \(15\mathbf{a} = 16\mathbf{b} - 9\mathbf{e}\), find the value of \(m\)

The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(OABC\). The point \(D\) lies on \(OB\) such that \(\overrightarrow{OD} = 2\overrightarrow{DB}\) and \(\overrightarrow{AD} = m\overrightarrow{AC}\), where \(m\) is a scalar quantity
Write down the range of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\)
Find \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) and write down its range
Solve \(2\mathrm{fg}(x) = 11\)
Find the equation of the normal to the curve \(y = \frac{\ln(3x^2 + 1)}{x^2}\) at the point where \(x = 2\), giving your answer
in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are correct to 2 decimal places. You must show all your working.
Find the coordinates of the points \(A\) and \(B\)
Find \(\int (12 + x - x^2) \mathrm{d}x\)
Showing all your working, find the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows the curve \(y = 12 + x - x^2\) intersecting the line \(y = x + 8\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\)
By finding the value of each of the constants \(a\) and \(b\), verify that \(a = b\)
Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\),
find \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) in the form \((2x - 1)\mathrm{q}(x)\), where \(\mathrm{q}(x)\) is a quadratic expression,
factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely,
solve \(a\sin^{3}\theta + 17\sin^{2}\theta + b\sin \theta - 8 = 0\) for \(0^{\circ}< \theta < 180^{\circ}\)
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = ax^{3} + 17x^{2} + bx - 8\) is divisible by \(2x - 1\) and has a remainder of \(-35\) when divided by \(x + 3\)
